post.title: Jackson's Adventure Around China Day 1 Guilin to Changsha
post.author: Jackson Hayes
post.content:
Here is the tentative plan as of now for the first few days of the trip.
June 28th Guilin -> Changsha
June 29th Shaoshan day trip
June 30th Changsha -> Lanzhou
Jun 31st Lanzhou -> Huhehaote
July 1st Huhehaote
July 2nd -> 4th Inner Mongolia TBD
July 5th - 6th Beijing
July 7th Beijing -> TBD
July 7th - 16th TBD
As I walked out of the door to my home-stay to go to the train station my I got a message from my mom with a wonderful idea. "Steal the rope!" (The door locking rope that was the bane of my existence.)

I am ready for this adventure in almost every way I can think of. CLI has prepared me with an awesome level of Chinese language, maybe better than I had hoped when I arrived. I have basically done all I need to do in Guilin, and I am quite tired of studying, you know after doing it for my entire life up to this point. It is time for something new.

I have basically no idea what this trip is going to be. The plan is no plan. There are cities I want to hit. Things I want to do, but it is all up for change at a moment's notice. This is how I want it to be.

My goals for this trip:

1. Return home safe (I am ever the pragmatic)
2. Ride a camel
3. See something more beautiful than I have ever seen before
4. Make a new friend worth knowing
5. Dumbfound a Chinese person with something I do
6. Dumfound myself with something crazy or stupid that I do
7. Return to my old favorites
8. Make a new favorite

(It doesn't need to be a goal to see a something dumbfounding done by a Chinese person, that pretty much happens every hour of the day when you travel here.)

The lady on the train next to me just up and grabbed the baby from a dad in the row in front of us. The baby was ok with it for about five seconds and then was like "uhhh you are not my mom, and your e-reader is not that cool please give me back" and started crying.

I am starting to get to the point where I don't actively notice that I am the only westerner in a place. It is my constant state and will be for the next few days more likely than not.
